messages: fce8e8f1f5eb450d51e74727c4b835ec (21:18): hmm, I've got a problem with my menu. I'm trying to dynamically generate a menu, so I created a vector<QAction*> accountAct and added several actions: accountAct.push_back(accountMenu->addAction("..."));
fce8e8f1f5eb450d51e74727c4b835ec (21:18): then connect(accountAct[0], SIGNAL(triggered()), this, SLOT(loadAccountfM(1)));
fce8e8f1f5eb450d51e74727c4b835ec (21:19): this doesn't seem to trigger the loadAccountfM function at all
fce8e8f1f5eb450d51e74727c4b835ec (21:20): is this because I can't put numbers in the brackets?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:24): Giggel: No, the problem is in your slot call.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:24): Giggel: You can't specify parameters in the signal or slot macros, only data types, and the signatures for the signal and slot have to match.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:24): Giggel: The signal is allowed to have more parameters than the slot.

cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:25): Giggel: If you need that functionality, use QSignalMapper to bounce the signals or use the sender() function in the slot to get a pointer to the object that triggered it.
fce8e8f1f5eb450d51e74727c4b835ec (21:25): hossa
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:25): Giggel: As a final note, you could use QList or QVector instead of std::vector
87210df20b5a76dfaa75970aab41eeb1 (21:26): better :)
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:26): Actually, for what it's worth, you really don't need the vector at all because accountMenu->actions() will contain the same thing
87210df20b5a76dfaa75970aab41eeb1 (21:28): ok, that's good. so I replace the global vector by a local variable
87210df20b5a76dfaa75970aab41eeb1 (21:30): and read the connect help to see how to pass an additional parameter to be able to differentiate between the calls
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:31): Like I said
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:32): Either use QSignalMapper or sender()
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:32): QSignalMapper is better OO, sender() is less code
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:33): Actually, sender() may not be less code after all.
87210df20b5a76dfaa75970aab41eeb1 (21:33): so you don't see a different aproach?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:33): Those ARE the approaches.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:33): That's how you're supposed to do it.
87210df20b5a76dfaa75970aab41eeb1 (21:33): good
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:33): !rtfm qsignalmapper
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (21:33): ahigerd: QSignalMapper (Qt 4.2) http://doc.trolltech.com/4.2/qsignalmapper.html
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:33): Very useful class.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:33): You can run this in a loop, by the way, no need to use numeric indexes anywhere
87210df20b5a76dfaa75970aab41eeb1 (21:33): I just wanted to be sure that there is no other way that every one would use which is much more simple :)
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (21:34): Hehe, nah, this is it.
